Header: Dimitrov upsets Federer to reach U.S. Open semis while Williams cruises through
Content: Grigor Dimitrov stepped out of Roger Federer’s shadow to claim a spot in the U.S. Open semi-finals with a shock 3-6 6-4 3-6 6-4 6-2 win over the wounded Swiss. Coming into the U.S. Open, the 78th ranked Dimitrov, dubbed “Baby Fed” because of the similarities between his game and Federer’s, did not look much of a threat, posting just one win from his last eight matches. But the Bulgarian, who had been ranked as high as number three, has found some form on the New York hardcourts and claimed his first win in eight meetings with the 20-times Grand Slam winner. Federer looked razor sharp to start the match but was not able to maintain his usual high level against the gritty Bulgarian.
